title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act 2022
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E)
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) 
(Prescription of Further Age to Whom Contraceptive Services Will Be Made 
Available Without Charge) (Amendment) Regulations 2024. 

(2) The Principal Regulations, the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) 
(Prescription of further age to whom contraceptive services will be made 
available without charge) (Amendment) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 408 of 
2023), the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) (Prescription of Further Age to Whom 
Contraceptive Services Will Be Made Available Without Charge) (Amendment) 
(No. 2) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 614 of 2023) and these Regulations may be 
cited together as the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) (Prescription of further age 
to whom contraceptive services will be made available without charge) 
Regulations 2022 to 2024.

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act 2022
heading: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 1 July 2024.
text_raw: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 1 July 2024.

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act 2022
heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Health Act 1970
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Health Act 1970 
(Section 67E) (Prescription of further age to whom contraceptive services will 
be made available without charge) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 675 of 2022).

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act 2022
heading: 4. The Schedule to the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting after
text_raw:
4. The Schedule to the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting after 

paragraph (2) the following paragraph: 

“(3) Attained the age of 32 but not yet attained the age of 36”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

12 June, 2024. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 14th June, 2024.

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act 2022
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

These Regulations are made under the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No.2) 
Act 2022. 

These Regulations amend the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) (Prescription of 
further age to whom contraceptive services will be made available without 
charge) Regulations 2022. 

These Regulations provide for the extension of the free contraception scheme to 
women up to and including those aged 35. 

The Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) (Prescription of further age to whom 
contraceptive services will be made available without charge) Regulations 2022 
(S.I. No. 675 of 2022), the Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) (Prescription of further 
age to whom contraceptive services will be made available without charge) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 408 of 2023), the Health Act 1970 
(Section 67E) (Prescription of Further Age to Whom Contraceptive Services 
Will Be Made Available Without Charge) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 
2023 (S.I. No. 614 of 2023) and these Regulations may be cited together as the 
Health Act 1970 (Section 67E) (Prescription of further age to whom 
contraceptive services will be made available without charge) Regulations 2022 
to 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [286]
